name: Insurance Additional Information
description: The Insurance Additional Information segment (IN3) contains additional insurance information that supplements the basic insurance data provided in the IN1 and IN2 segments. This segment is essential for complex billing workflows, prior authorization processes, and managed care operations. The IN3 segment supports advanced insurance features including certification numbers, pre-authorization details, penalty information, and special insurance program requirements. It is particularly important for healthcare organizations managing multiple insurance plans and complex reimbursement scenarios.

cardinality.note: Multiple IN3 segments can be used for different insurance plans or authorization details

IN3.1.name: Set ID - IN3
IN3.1.description: This field contains the sequence number for the IN3 segment when multiple insurance additional information segments are present.
IN3.1.generationHint: Sequential numbering: 1, 2, 3, etc. for multiple insurance additional information records

IN3.2.name: Certification Number
IN3.2.description: This field contains the certification number assigned by the insurance plan for pre-authorized services or treatments.
IN3.2.generationHint: Pre-authorization or certification numbers like AUTH123456^BCBS or CERT789012^AETNA

IN3.3.name: Certified By
IN3.3.description: This field identifies the person or organization that provided the certification for the insurance coverage.
IN3.3.generationHint: Insurance company representative, case manager, or medical director who approved authorization

IN3.4.name: Certification Required
IN3.4.description: This field indicates whether certification is required for this insurance plan or specific service.
IN3.4.generationHint: Y for managed care plans requiring pre-authorization, N for traditional fee-for-service

IN3.5.name: Penalty
IN3.5.description: This field contains information about penalties applied for non-compliance with insurance requirements.
IN3.5.generationHint: Penalty amounts for unauthorized services or out-of-network usage

IN3.6.name: Certification Date/Time
IN3.6.description: This field contains the date and time when the insurance certification was obtained or approved.
IN3.6.generationHint: Date when pre-authorization was approved by insurance company

IN3.7.name: Certification Modify Date/Time
IN3.7.description: This field contains the date and time when the insurance certification was last modified or updated.
IN3.7.generationHint: When authorization was modified, extended, or updated

IN3.8.name: Operator
IN3.8.description: This field identifies the person who entered or modified the insurance certification information.
IN3.8.generationHint: Registration staff, case manager, or billing personnel who processed authorization

IN3.9.name: Certification Begin Date
IN3.9.description: This field contains the date when the insurance certification becomes effective.
IN3.9.generationHint: Start date for authorized services coverage

IN3.10.name: Certification End Date
IN3.10.description: This field contains the date when the insurance certification expires.
IN3.10.generationHint: End date for authorized services coverage

IN3.11.name: Days
IN3.11.description: This field contains the number of days for which the certification is valid.
IN3.11.generationHint: Duration of authorization in days: 30, 60, 90 for different service types

IN3.12.name: Non-Concur Code/Description
IN3.12.description: This field contains codes or descriptions for situations where there is disagreement about the necessity or appropriateness of care.
IN3.12.generationHint: Used when insurance company disagrees with provider recommendations

IN3.13.name: Non-Concur Effective Date/Time
IN3.13.description: This field contains the date and time when the non-concur status becomes effective.
IN3.13.generationHint: When insurance disagreement or denial becomes effective

IN3.14.name: Physician Reviewer
IN3.14.description: This field identifies the physician who reviewed the case for the insurance company.
IN3.14.generationHint: Insurance company medical director or physician reviewer

IN3.15.name: Certification Contact
IN3.15.description: This field contains contact information for the person or department responsible for certification issues.
IN3.15.generationHint: Phone number or contact information for authorization department

IN3.16.name: Certification Contact Phone Number
IN3.16.description: This field contains the phone number for contacting the certification authority.
IN3.16.generationHint: Direct phone line to insurance authorization department

IN3.17.name: Appeal Reason
IN3.17.description: This field contains the reason for appealing an insurance decision or denial.
IN3.17.generationHint: Used when appealing insurance denials or adverse determinations

IN3.18.name: Certification Agency
IN3.18.description: This field identifies the agency or organization responsible for certification decisions.
IN3.18.generationHint: Insurance company or government agency making certification decisions

IN3.19.name: Certification Agency Phone Number
IN3.19.description: This field contains the phone number for the certification agency.
IN3.19.generationHint: Main contact number for insurance company certification department

IN3.20.name: Pre-Certification Requirement
IN3.20.description: This field contains information about pre-certification requirements for specific services or procedures.
IN3.20.generationHint: Specific procedures or diagnoses requiring pre-certification

IN3.21.name: Case Manager
IN3.21.description: This field identifies the case manager assigned to coordinate care and insurance approvals.
IN3.21.generationHint: Insurance company case manager name for complex cases

IN3.22.name: Second Opinion Date
IN3.22.description: This field contains the date when a second opinion was obtained or is required.
IN3.22.generationHint: Date second opinion was obtained for insurance approval

IN3.23.name: Second Opinion Status
IN3.23.description: This field indicates the status of the second opinion requirement.
IN3.23.generationHint: R for procedures requiring second opinion, O when completed

IN3.24.name: Second Opinion Documentation Received
IN3.24.description: This field indicates whether second opinion documentation has been received by the insurance company.
IN3.24.generationHint: Y when insurance has received all required second opinion documentation

IN3.25.name: Second Opinion Physician
IN3.25.description: This field identifies the physician who provided the second opinion.
IN3.25.generationHint: Independent physician providing second opinion for insurance approval

epic.notes: Epic provides comprehensive authorization workflows with automated prior auth and appeal tracking

cerner.notes: Cerner emphasizes clinical review processes and case management coordination

allscripts.notes: Allscripts provides essential authorization management for practice-based workflows

athenahealth.notes: Athenahealth focuses on revenue cycle and automated prior authorization processes

notes: IN3 segment provides detailed insurance authorization and certification information
Set ID (IN3.1) is the only required field, making this a flexible supplemental segment
Critical for prior authorization workflows and managed care operations
Supports complex appeals processes and second opinion requirements
Essential for revenue cycle management and insurance compliance
Case manager and physician reviewer fields support care coordination

dataConsistency.certificationDates: Begin date (IN3.9) should precede end date (IN3.10)
dataConsistency.authorizationFlow: Certification number should align with certification agency
dataConsistency.reviewerAlignment: Physician reviewer should match certification agency
dataConsistency.contactConsistency: Contact information should be consistent with certification agency

businessRules.authorizationRequirements: Managed care plans typically require certification (IN3.4 = Y)
businessRules.timelinessRules: Pre-authorizations should be obtained before service dates
businessRules.appealProcesses: Appeals should reference specific denial reasons and provide supporting documentation
businessRules.caseManagement: Complex cases should have assigned case managers for coordination
businessRules.complianceTracking: All authorization activities should be documented for audit purposes

messageFlow.workflow: Essential for managed care operations, prior authorization, and revenue cycle management
